info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 7:14AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Elbert and southeastern Hart Counties through 800 AM EST... At 713 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Danielsville, or near Hull, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elberton, Hartwell, Bowman, Russell State Park, Reed Creek, Royston, Lake Russell, Dewy Rose, Nuberg and Ruckersville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Conditions are favorable for development of a very brief, weak tornado. Be prepared to take immediate action if a tornado is sighted or a Tornado Warning is issued.
